beer.beer_name: Farmers Pour Extra Crispy Pale Ale

items.checkin_comment: Probably the pick of the bunch so far

beer.beer_name: Farmers Pour Extra Crispy Pale Ale
beer.beer_description: 30 yrs of The Country radio show, means 3 decades of Jamie Mackay’s dulcet tones filling our airwaves. He sure can talk. But Raymond Bowan & Richard Emerson came up with a plan : Farmers Cut extra thick chips, paired with Farmers Pour extra crispy pale ale. It’s the perfect farmers combo, to celebrate a real farming legend. Best of all, it should keep Jamie quiet- for a moment at least

items.badge_description: Kiwis, rugby and sheep aren’t the only things New Zealand has to offer. There’s a ton of great beers in a variety of styles just waiting for you to explore! That's 55 different beers from a brewery in New Zealand. Try 5 more for Level 12.

beer.beer_description:
The combination of NZ and US hops in the boil, the hopback, and dry hopping, makes this true India Pale Ale a significant addition to our range.  
 
Bird Dog has always been a tribute to The Verlaines album by the same name, and John Collie’s painting which appeared on the Bird Dog album features on the Bird Dog label.
  
Serve 8 – 10° C

items.badge_description: Looking for more kick than a session beer, but want to be able to stay for a few rounds? You have to keep it in the middle. That's 30 beers with an ABV greater than 5% and less than 10%. Try 5 more for Level 7!

Kiwis, rugby and sheep aren’t the only things New Zealand has to offer. There’s a ton of great beers in a variety of styles just waiting for you to explore! That's 35 different beers from a brewery in New Zealand. Try 5 more for Level 8.

beer.beer_description: A big, bold, Hazy Double IPA, with intense citrus and tropical flavours, and gooseberry and grape aromas. At 7.8% ABV it's a good one to share, perhaps with one of your Nice friends.
beer.beer_style: IPA - Imperial / Double New England / Hazy

beer.beer_description: If Hazed & Confused is a trip for your taste buds, Hazed & Ginfused took the scenic route. Four weeks in a gin barrel from Cardrona Distillery, to be precise. It has all the hoppy, tropical, and citrus flavours you expect, plus the orange zest, juniper, and rosehip botanicals it took in along the way. Now that's what you call flower power.

items.badge_description: You may not be able to see through the haze, but that juicy, hoppy goodness goes down smooth. What started as a trend is here to stay. That's 85 different beers with the style of IPA - New England / Hazy, Pale Ale - New England / Hazy, IPA - Milkshake, or Pale Ale - Milkshake. Try 5 more for Level 18!

beer.beer_description:
This tasty NZ IPA is made with NZ hops for a bold local flavor. Tropical fruits, clean citrus notes, and a hint of passionfruit will reverberate around your taste buds. 
As a young man, Richard was a huge fan of the Dunedin Sound. Being deaf, he couldn’t hear the music, but he could feel it. From the jangling guitars reverberating through the gigs. This beer is a tribute to The Sound, made with NZ hops for a bold local flavor, that will reverberate around your taste buds.

items.badge_description: Your quest to quench your thirst leaves no stone unturned! That's at least 50 distinct venues!

Looking for more kick than a session beer, but want to be able to stay for a few rounds? You have to keep it in the middle. That's 395 beers with an ABV greater than 5% and less than 10%.  Try 5 more for Level 80!
We believe in IPA and you should too. You certainly have a taste for the hops! That's 325 different IPAs. Try 5 more for Level 66! Want to learn more about this badge? Check out our podcast

beer.beer_description: A classic example of a Czech Pilsner. Rich bready malt, spicy hop and moreish mouthfeel
Snow Business is a cold IPA, brewed at chillier-than-usual temperatures, to be crisp and refreshing.
A big, bold, Hazy Double IPA, with intense citrus and tropical flavours, and gooseberry and grape aromas. At 7.8% ABV it's a good one to share, perhaps with one of your Nice friends.
beer.beer_style: IPA - Imperial / Double New England / Hazy

beer.beer_description: A hallucinatory, mind-bending, consciousness-expanding, dream like experience is not what you'll find in this can. It's just a beer, man. But, this cloudy IPA does have a gnarly hit of Riwaka, Simcoe and Mosaic hops, with a tropical citrus flavour, and a totally piney finish. At least it's a trip for your taste buds. Far out.

items.badge_description: You may not be able to see through the haze, but that juicy, hoppy goodness goes down smooth. What started as a trend is here to stay. That's 30 different beers with the style of IPA - New England / Hazy, Pale Ale - New England / Hazy, IPA - Milkshake, or Pale Ale - Milkshake. Try 5 more for Level 7!

beer.beer_name: Farmers Pour Extra Crispy Pale Ale
beer.beer_description: 30 yrs of The Country radio show, means 3 decades of Jamie Mackay’s dulcet tones filling our airwaves. He sure can talk. But Raymond Bowan & Richard Emerson came up with a plan : Farmers Cut extra thick chips, paired with Farmers Pour extra crispy pale ale. It’s the perfect farmers combo, to celebrate a real farming legend. Best of all, it should keep Jamie quiet- for a moment at least

The 2024 Bird of the Year is now also the Bird with a Beer. We love our hoiho here in Dunedin, and are proud to have played a part in turning its yellow eyes gold — for the second time. People's Penguin is easy-drinking, with vibrant notes of stone fruit, and a biscuity malt backbone.
It features local Garston Rakau hops, and Riwaka Amplifire hop oil from Clayton. Enjoy the sweet taste of victory.

beer.beer_name: Farmers Pour Extra Crispy Pale Ale
beer.beer_description: 30 yrs of The Country radio show, means 3 decades of Jamie Mackay’s dulcet tones filling our airwaves. He sure can talk. But Raymond Bowan & Richard Emerson came up with a plan : Farmers Cut extra thick chips, paired with Farmers Pour extra crispy pale ale. It’s the perfect farmers combo, to celebrate a real farming legend. Best of all, it should keep Jamie quiet- for a moment at least

items.badge_description: Ahh, the trusty pale ale; crisp, refreshing, and always a good choice in a bind. That's 100 different Pale Ales or American Pale Wheats. Try 5 more for Level 21.

Kiwis, rugby and sheep aren’t the only things New Zealand has to offer. There’s a ton of great beers in a variety of styles just waiting for you to explore! That's 460 different beers from a brewery in New Zealand.  Try 5 more for Level 93!

beer.beer_name: Farmers Pour Extra Crispy Pale Ale
beer.beer_description: 30 yrs of The Country radio show, means 3 decades of Jamie Mackay’s dulcet tones filling our airwaves. He sure can talk. But Raymond Bowan & Richard Emerson came up with a plan : Farmers Cut extra thick chips, paired with Farmers Pour extra crispy pale ale. It’s the perfect farmers combo, to celebrate a real farming legend. Best of all, it should keep Jamie quiet- for a moment at least

A ‘Kiwi Classic’, Pilsner is a showcase for Nelson grown Riwaka hops. Its overt fruitiness begs comparison with Malborough’s world-beating Sauvignon Blancs. Emerson’s Pilsner oozes citrus and passionfruit aromas and flavours. The beer’s palate shows a hint of early malt sweetness but develops a lengthy dry finish.

One of New Zealand’s first new generation pale ales and now something of a classic, Emerson’s 1812 is all about balance. Pouring a bright amber hue beneath a deep cream coloured head, the aroma hints at caramel and dark toffee balanced with a light citrusy fruitiness.
Medium bodied, the palate first offers a
marmalade-like combination of ripe citrus and caramelised malts before resiny hops come to the fore and lead into a lingering dry finish.

A wonderfully drinkable interpretation of a classic
English ale. Bookbinder is a blend of four malts
combined with two classic Nelson grown European
hops (Fuggles and Riwaka). The beer pours an
attractive reddish brown, with a cream coloured
head. Bookbinder has a sweet, perfumy, malt
and hop aroma with a soft, malty, fruit and vinous
palate that is both full flavoured and
refreshing with a long, gently drying finish.

The combination of NZ and US hops in the boil, the hopback, and dry hopping, makes this true India Pale Ale a significant addition to our range.  
 
Bird Dog has always been a tribute to The Verlaines album by the same name, and John Collie’s painting which appeared on the Bird Dog album features on the Bird Dog label.
  
Serve 8 – 10° C

A hallucinatory, mind-bending, consciousness-expanding, dream like experience is not what you'll find in this can. It's just a beer, man. But, this cloudy IPA does have a gnarly hit of Riwaka, Simcoe and Mosaic hops, with a tropical citrus flavour, and a totally piney finish. At least it's a trip for your taste buds. Far out.

Porter is the oldest commercially brewed style.
Dark, dry and mellow with some hop
characteristics, it was the favourite tipple of
London’s porters. London Porter pours a deep
brown colour with reddish tints, and the aroma is
toasty, with a hint of sweetness and some earthy
hop notes. Firm-bodied, but not heavy, with a
creamy texture, the dryish palate is full of
roasted malt, coffeeish notes and a sustained
bitterness.
Hazy Tropical Pale Ale
Big Rig from Emersons is a big hop bomb APA with a trio of US, Australian and NZ hops giving a fantastic balance of tropical and citrus flavours on a clean malt base with subtle caramel notes.

At last, our popular Red Ale is in the bottle! A real favourite amongst our brewing team.  The subtle hoppy flavours give little clue to what develops once you start tasting the beer…luscious malt body, hints of fruity toffee apples, then a long complex finish that inspires another mouthful to experience the full range of flavours all over again!  Just the beer for the cool evenings in front of open fires, or for you townies – a heat pump.

Food Match: Treat as a digestif or with a sharp aged cheddar with quince paste.
Whisky Match: Glenfiddich 15 year old.
Style: Red Ale

This tasty NZ IPA is made with NZ hops for a bold local flavor. Tropical fruits, clean citrus notes, and a hint of passionfruit will reverberate around your taste buds. 
As a young man, Richard was a huge fan of the Dunedin Sound. Being deaf, he couldn’t hear the music, but he could feel it. From the jangling guitars reverberating through the gigs. This beer is a tribute to The Sound, made with NZ hops for a bold local flavor, that will reverberate around your taste buds.
Super Quench your Super Thirst - a lighter style Pacific pilsner with 40% less carbs than the average Emerson's beer

Brewers Guild of New Zealand Trophy Winner for Stouts and Porters 2016

It displays all the classic stout, characteristics. Black as tar, opulent roast and chocolate notes yet hopped in the way we would hop an American Style Pale Ale.

The malt grist is made up primarily of ale, roast barley, chocolate and crystal malts, with rolled oats included to add that smooth mouth feel. 

Phantom Lord has been mash hopped, first wort hopped, hopped in the kettle and once boiled, the steaming hot wort has been pumped through fresh, new season hop cones – hop backed! 

Fermenting with an English Ale yeast has added a luxurious depth to the malty mouthfeel. Once this yeast has almost done its work, we have pumped another massive dose of hop pellets into the fermenter.

This beer is brought to you by the number three. Three brewer's, from three breweries put their heads together to come up with a three part brew. Emerson's, Behemoth and Funk Estate created this sour, mango, India Pale Ale. We suggest you get some people together to enjoy this full-flavoured drop. Three's a good number

On the back of the success Big Rig APA, the brew crew thought it would be a great idea to brew Big Rig’s bigger brother. 

American Graffiti is a luscious American Pale Ale, with a tonne of hops that seem to be overflowing in your pint. Not over the top in alcohol but packed full of juicy American hops. The combination of 5 American hops results in a rich tropical citrus flavours with a touch of spice on the finish.

This should be drunk like a young wine, when it comes to this amount of hops fresh is definitely best…

This exquisite spiced ale, released annually and
brewed with the addition of three spices and organic
clover honey from Central Otago is bottleconditioned
prior to release.
Cinnamon and nutmeg notes are evident in the
aroma and on the palate with the combination of
spices evoking flavours reminiscent of hot-cross
buns.

This might be the warmingest cold beer known to man. Inspired by chilli hot chocolate, Mexioco is a collaboration with our good friends down the road at Ocho Chocolate. This rich, dark porter is brewed with roasted cacao nibs, red chillies, vanilla, and cinnamon. Best served on a bone-chilling, ear-stinging, breezing winter's night.
A tart, refreshing ale using umeboshi (a pickled Japanese plum). Tart and refreshing!

In Roman mythology, Vertumnus is the god of seasons, change and plant growth, as well as gardens and fruit trees..  Change!  Now there’s a thought….whilst enjoying our Pilsner one spring afternoon at the brewery, the the brew crew asked what if we….? So we damn well did.

We took everyone’s favourite Pilsner and swapped every NZ hop in the recipe for those sassy US hops we love to use in our Brewer’s Reserves.  Lifting the alcohol level to close to 6% and a touch of dry hopping has created a beautiful, bitter, crisp and aromatic Pilsner.  The aroma screams hops and expectations are fully met all the way to the bottom of the glass… which seems to happen all too often with this beautiful pint.

The brewers reckon this is the best thing that should have come out of America since triple bacon burgers and the Double Down.  Raise a glass of Vertumnus,  to Spring and all that it brings – here’s to a nice change!

Cheers,
The Brew Crew 

Original gravity:  1054
Alcohol : 5.9 % vol
Malts : Lager, Caramalts
Hops :  Simcoe, Cascade, Centennial, Zythos 
Yeast:  Ale
Not to be confused with the event where millions of people disappear. This Black IPA, darkened with dehusked malt, with a mass of American hops, is worth hanging around for

It take a lot to get a hardy St Clair surfer out of the water. That's why we named this kolsch after the one thing that lures them out of the surf - the shark bell. Refreshing, crisp and zesty - it's never too cold to enjoy a cold one, at St Clair
Named for a long serving, loyal Emerson's drinker, A Beer Called Gary is a New Zealand hopped pale ale, with a bit of a kick!
